history.content:
The probability covered in CS 70 is covered in Stat 140 with more depth, and then some. I would guess that Stat 140 is adequate, though others chiming in would be great.

-----

Another opinion: If you take Stat 140 and don't take CS 70 you are well prepared for CS 189. Stat 140 goes a lot more in depth into probability than CS 70 does.

opinion 3: if you are only looking for probability then this is very viable. However if you want to go into math or other CS theory CS70 may be broader

Hello, I was wondering if anyone had taken Stat 140/Stat 134 and then taken any CS upper divs after without taking CS70. I know that both classes cover probability, so I wanted to see if I would be able to survive in classes (say CS 189 or CS 188) without having formally taken 70. My major doesn't require 70 which is why I am wondering if I should opt out of the class. If you have, how did it work out?
history.subject: Stat 140 instead of CS70
